measured_by: proportion of risky option choices in the 5-trial two-option risky choice task with goals
justification: “Risk Preferences. Overall, participants chose the risky option in 49% of all choices… Table 1 shows that the participants selected the risky option…” – indicating that risk preference was quantified by counting how often the risky option was chosen in the experimental task.

measured_by: percentage of participant choices that matched the optimal model’s prescribed option
justification: “Choice Optimality in Framed Choices with Goals. Overall, 68% of the observed choices aligned with the optimal model.” – the construct ‘choice optimality’ is operationalised as the share of decisions identical to the optimal model’s recommendation.

measured_by: success rate (proportion of choice problems in which the goal was reached)
justification: “Task Performance. Collapsed across framing conditions participants achieved the goal in 52% of all choice problems… Table 1 displays the success rate…” – the construct of performance toward the goal is assessed by the proportion of tasks in which the preset goal was reached.
